Wanderlog staff
Updated • updatedNov 7, 2024

East London, a hidden gem on South Africa's Eastern Cape, is a vibrant city that offers a delightful mix of culinary experiences. From charming beachfront eateries to cozy family-run restaurants, this coastal town is brimming with flavors that reflect its rich culture and stunning surroundings. Whether you're craving fresh seafood, hearty pub fare, or international cuisine, East London has something to satisfy every palate. Imagine enjoying a craft beer at Emerald Vale Brewery while soaking in the breathtaking views of the verdant landscapes, or savoring a Mediterranean dish at Grazia Fine Food & Wine with the gentle ocean breeze at your back.

As you explore the culinary landscape of East London, you'll discover a variety of dining spots that cater to families, foodies, and everyone in between. Picture yourself indulging in a delicious breakfast at The Beach Break, where the festive atmosphere is perfect for a morning with loved ones, or treating yourself to a unique dining experience at The Cow and Milk Shed, known for its reinvented comfort food. With so many options to choose from, the Wanderlog team is excited to share our favorite places to eat in this charming city. So grab your appetite and get ready to explore the best restaurants East London has to offer!

Why trust us
We scoured through the internet and read through 9 reputable sites and blogs like foodandhome.co.za and afristay.com. We gathered all the results in one place and ranked them by how many times they were mentioned so you know you're getting the best of the best. Just look for the "mentioned by" tags on each place.

1Grazia Fine Food & Wine

4.5
(1880)
•
4.5
(645)

Mentioned on 
4 lists 
$$$$affordable
Restaurant
Grazia Fine Food & Wine is a Mediterranean restaurant in East London with outdoor seating and parking available. The menu includes Italian dishes such as seafood and pasta, European favourites like shepherd's pie, and international favourites like buffalo chicken wrap. The restaurant also has a full bar serving wine and beer, and accepts American Express, Mastercard, and Visa.
Slide 1 of 8
“I recently had the pleasure of dining at Grazia Fine Food & Wine in East London, and the experience was truly exceptional. Sisanda provided outstanding service with genuine warmth, making us feel welcomed and well cared for throughout the evening. The food was phenomenal—beautifully presented, bursting with flavor, and clearly crafted with passion. The ambiance at Grazia is fantastic, creating an ideal setting for a memorable dining experience. Highly recommended for anyone seeking exquisite cuisine, excellent service, and an unforgettable atmosphere in East London!”
Jonathan M — Google review

Charmaine M — Google review
There is always something welcoming when all people at an eatery go out of their way to make you feel welcome and catered for. The Warmth of Welcome Stepping into Grazia, it's not just the tantalizing aromas that greet you, but the genuine warmth of the staff. From the moment you're welcomed at the door, you're enveloped in an atmosphere of hospitality that makes you feel like a long-lost friend. The servers, with their infectious smiles and attentive service, effortlessly balance efficiency and friendliness. They're knowledgeable about the menu, making recommendations tailored to your preferences, and are always ready to accommodate dietary restrictions or special requests. Their genuine care for the dining experience elevates the meal beyond just the food. It's the little things that truly set the staff apart. A friendly chat about your day, a thoughtful suggestion for a wine pairing, or simply a timely refill of your water glass – these small gestures create a memorable dining experience. The staff's ability to strike the perfect balance between attentiveness and unobtrusiveness ensures that you feel well-cared-for without ever feeling rushed or pressured. In a world often dominated by impersonal service, Grazia stands out as a beacon of hospitality. The friendly staff transforms a meal into a delightful social occasion, making it a place where you can relax, enjoy good food, and feel truly valued.

Lavender Blue Market, Café & Deli is a must-visit spot in the Eastern Cape, particularly if you're traveling on Route 72 between East London and Port Elizabeth. This family-friendly destination offers a delightful atmosphere with ample space for children to play while you enjoy delicious eats and drinks. The market features a variety of offerings including fresh produce, delectable sauces, sweets, and gifts. Additionally, there's a shop with beautiful clothes and more gifts to explore.

Nestled in a serene environment, The Beach Break Cafe is a beloved spot for both locals and visitors seeking a delightful dining experience. Renowned for its exceptional coffee, light lunches, hearty breakfasts, and delectable cakes, this family-friendly cafe offers an array of healthy options like chicken wraps and scrumptious carrot cake. Guests can unwind under the trees while savoring their meals in a peaceful atmosphere that encourages relaxation.

4Emerald Vale Brewery

4.6
(804)
•
4.0
(52)

Mentioned on 
4 lists 
$$$$affordable
Restaurant
Food & Drink
Bar
Nestled in the picturesque Cintsa East, just a short drive from East London, Emerald Vale Brewery is a charming family-owned establishment offering stunning views of the Eastern Cape's verdant landscapes. The brewery boasts a play area for children and serves up delectable pub-style dishes alongside their craft beers, all made with fresh rainwater. Whether you prefer Pale, Gold, Amber or Dark Ale, there's something to suit every beer enthusiast's palate.
Slide 1 of 8
If you’re exploring the Wild Coast, a stop at Emerald Vale Brewery is an absolute must. Tucked between the Chintsa and Cefani rivers, this destination captures the very essence of South Africa’s coastal charm. Local Legend Chris Heaton and his team have crafted a space that’s a perfect blend of nature, adventure, and warm hospitality. The setting here is truly magical. With the rugged beauty of the Wild Coast surrounding you, trails for mountain biking, hiking, or even just a lazy amble invite you to soak up the scenery at your own pace. The food is proper, hearty South African fare, perfect for refuelling after a trail or to pair with one of the craft beers on offer. Whether you’re here for the views, the vibe, or a taste of something local, Emerald Vale offers a memorable Wild Coast experience that goes far beyond a cold drink.
Holger M — Google review
Had a wonderful evening sitting by the fire. Service is very friendly, delicious pizza and I enjoyed the music playlist. Very cozy, would love to return on my next trip to South Africa. Many thanks to the staff.
Laurie — Google review
My mom and I had lunch there. We ordered the hawaiian pizza and chicken strips with chips. Beautiful scenery and lovely setup, so peaceful. Staff were friendly and assisted quickly, our food order arrived at our table sooner than I expected. There was a lot of parking available and signs everywhere, making it easy to find everything. I'll definitely be back again and will maybe try out the mountain bike trails they have there on the premises.

What a delightful place! We enjoyed such a wonderful Sunday lunch here - the staff are super friendly and their food's really tasty! We also tried a sample tray of their home brew beer, which we thoroughly enjoyed. There are a couple of walking trails and we would like to hike some of them soon. Great experience!

The play area for the little ones is close by. Definitely a place to try if you have not been there yet. Before or after you can take a walk (hike) along some of the trails starting from a 1km upto a 28km. That being said the food was really good, one of the best burgers around. Thick juicy patties no shyness with the meat, well cooked. Nestled in The Crossing of Beacon Bay, Cantina & Craft is a vibrant Mexican-themed restaurant that promises an unforgettable dining experience for the whole family. Dean B — Google review
Upon entering the venue, I was genuinely surprised by its emptiness, a hidden gem along the beachfront that seems to fly under the radar. The lack of buzz may have contributed to the quiet atmosphere, creating an unexpected intimate setting as my girlfriend and I settled in. Notably, the restaurant primarily caters to hotel guests, a detail that becomes apparent in the clientele. It's more of a hidden oasis for those staying at the hotel than a bustling spot for outsiders just discovering it as they stroll by the beach. Seated in the seemingly deserted restaurant, I couldn't resist making a light-hearted comment to my girlfriend, joking that I'd rented out the entire place for her. The emptiness, rather than feeling eerie, added a unique charm to the evening. We opted for the Tomahawk Steak special, priced at R280, which included two sides, chips, and a beer. Despite my girlfriend choosing a cocktail instead, we found the portion size generous enough to share. The steak, cooked to a perfect medium, was a highlight—juicy, flavorful, and a testament to the restaurant's expertise in meat preparation. While the experience was overall enjoyable, it's important to note that the restaurant exclusively focuses on meat. For carnivores, this is a haven, but those seeking a more diverse menu might find the options limited. The sides accompanying the steak were well-prepared, with the chips standing out for their flavorful seasoning. My girlfriend's cocktail, while not detailed on the menu, showcased the bartender's skill with its unique blend of flavors. Service was prompt, and the ambiance, although quiet, had a certain charm, with attentive staff contributing to a pleasant evening. In conclusion, if you're a meat enthusiast seeking a tranquil dining experience away from the crowds, this steakhouse might just be your perfect spot. For those with a more diverse palate, the limited menu may leave you wanting more variety. My girlfriend and I left with smiles, having enjoyed a delightful evening in our seemingly private beachside haven.

Clarina E — Google review
I just did another interesting taste test between 2 Butter Chicken Curries made at 2 of East London's leading curry shops (and both of them in Berea): Red Chillies in Chamerlain Road and Irana in Glaston Street. Both businesses are clean and presentable, both with friendly and professional staff and both of them give very good service. I had to compare apples with apples, so I decided on a regular sized Butter Chicken Currie with rice, to use as a common denominator. You will see in my picture that Red Chillies gives you more curry than Irana, as their curry take away container is bigger that Irana's, while the size of the rice is almost the same. Irana served a mixture of white and yellow rice and Red Chillies served white rice. The price at Irana was R109, while Red Chillies charged R90. Now for the most important part, THE CURRY COMPARISON: Irana's Butter Chicken Curry was yellowish in colour, the chicken breast was cut into larger cubes and it was dryer than that of Red Chillies. Still, the spices used was flavourful and delicious. The Butter Chicken Curry from Red Chillies was more orangy in colour, the chicken breast was cut into smaller cubes and the curry had a lot more gravy. It had a distinctly different and slightly sweeter taste that that of Irana, but also had a delicious blend of spices and lovely flavours. Both of these establishments serve a good quality and tasty Butter Chicken Curry and are well worth a visit. Well done guys!👏😉👍🏻 I can't wait to compare both of your Beef Curries!👌🤤

Coffee shop
Café du Jardin is a charming gem nestled within the Floradale Nursery in Beacon Bay, where you can unwind under a canopy of beautiful vines.
